dialogs.line: Ah, a traveler! My friend, the other knight, told me about you. I see you’ve chosen to walk without armor. They’re quite proud of you!
It’s not an easy path, but it shows you trust in your allies and your own agility.
Hmph. Trust and agility won’t stop an arrow from finding its mark. You’ll need every bit of wit and luck in this forest.
Don’t let his words scare you. You’ve chosen wisely. Together, we’ll navigate these dangers as a team.

dialogs.question: But before you go, one last offer: Will you reconsider and take some armor to shield yourself?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll take the armor. Maybe some protection is worth it.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll go without. My allies are all the protection I need.

dialogs.line: A wise choice. At least now you’ll have some protection in this perilous forest.
If that’s what you believe is best, I respect your decision. But remember, we’re here to help—don’t let the armor keep us too far away.
Excellent! You’ve chosen trust over barriers. My friend will be thrilled, and we’ll stand strong together.
Hmph. Suit yourself. Just remember—there’s no undoing a fatal wound.
So, you chose to take the armor. My friend was hoping you’d rely more on your allies. They trust you, you know.
Bah! Trust is no substitute for steel when blades are drawn.
Are you sure that armor is what you need? Sometimes protection can weigh you down more than the danger you face.

dialogs.question: What will you do now? Keep what you have, add more, or shed some to trust your allies?
dialogs.answer0: I’ll buy more armor. Better safe than sorry.
dialogs.answer1: I’ll shed some armor. My allies are all the protection I need.
dialogs.answer2: I’ll keep what I have. It’s a balanced choice.

dialogs.line: Ah, an even wiser choice! Extra armor will serve you well.
If that’s what you think is best, so be it. But remember, there’s more to strength than steel.
I hope you’ll still let us in, friend.
Ah, you’ve decided to shed some armor. My friend will be pleased!
We’ll face any danger together, as comrades.
Hmph. That’s your choice, I suppose. Just don’t blame me if you regret it.
Keeping what you have? A balanced choice, I suppose.
Just remember to stay vigilant.
That’s fair. Stay steady, friend. We’re with you, armor or not.
